pullRequest.body:
This PR provides constructors for presheaves of modules over a presheaf of rings `R` using families of (bundled or unbundled) modules over `R.obj X` for all `X`.

---

These constructions are necessary in order to study limits in the category of presheaves of modules. (The construction of limits is mostly done in the draft branch `RingMod4` https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/RingMod4/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Presheaf/Limits.lean )

- [x] depends on: #6915

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8656337712/job/23736712003)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8656337712/job/23736712139)

LGTM!
LGTM!

I'm not a huge fan of `MkStruct` as a name. In other situations mathlib uses a `Core` prefix, eg to build a normed abelian group from "core data".
Relatedly, in which namespace does `MkStruct` live?

Thanks for the review! Currently, `MkStruct` and `BundledMkStruct` are both under the `PresheafOfModules` namespace. Do you suggest something like `CorePresheafOfModules` and `BundledCorePresheafOfModules` in the root namespace? (I would slightly prefer having this under the `PresheafOfModules` namespace, like `PresheafOfModules.MkCore`, `PresheafOfModules.BundledMkCore`.) What do you think?
I have changed this to `CorePresheafOfModules` and `BundledCorePresheafOfModules`.
Same namespace question here.
Maybe this can be grouped together with the `mk'` constructor above?
Yes, thanks for the suggestion.
Why is this in the `PresheafOfModules` namespace and not in the `CorePresheafOfModules` namespace? I would think the latter allows dot notation on `M`?
I have changed this to `CorePresheafOfModules.toPresheafOfModules` and similar for the other.
I am wondering whether it should be `X : Cáµ’áµ–` or `X : C`? I guess, the first is more natural for building up the theory while the former might be more convenient to use?

Changing `Cáµ’áµ–` to `C` may only create more issues while developing the theory, so that I would not rather not experiment with this. It seems to me that the possible gain for the future applications is very close to zero.
To be consistent with the naming in the rest of this file, `M` and `M'` could be called `P` and `Q` here. And should this also be in the `Hom` namespace? Then dot notation works on `f`?
I have changed `M` and `M'` to `P`, `Q`, but I am not so sure about the namespace change because dot notation does not work in that case (Lean does not see that ` P âŸ¶ Q` is also `Hom P Q`).
Minor nitpick: Does the import list have to be sorted alphabetically? If yes, the two imports should be in reversed order.
Just making sure: You made `mk''` an `abbrev` so this is no longer needed?
Yes!

```suggestion
```
